column4: Tried running that terminal flash drive "dd" delete thing, but it didn't work. I keep getting the error "Could not format /dev/sdd1"
(The error appears after I run "Create Live USB system"
I did all the stuff on the wiki, had no luck. That's why I'm asking on here.
so what failed when you followed the guide at http://www.pendrivelinux.com exactly?
Lol but I mean how close am I? I shouldn't be too close at all, I think? Since it's new? Formatting only counts as 1 read/write (per cell of memory)?
did you see the part in all those guides you read about syslinux and maybe needing to use a lilo command to make the flash drive bootable?
No, but I'ev heard about syslinux. I have since then, however, decided not to install Linux on the drive and murder it. :P It costs too much to go killing it. :P
the way that persistent installs work, minimises writes
But it would still shorten the life. And what about all of the other stuff the OS does that involves writing to stuff to (what it thinks is) the hard drive, like KenBW2 said?
it's all done in RAM on a decent persistent USB system
I'd do it but it's fine, really. The people at the public library would probably get mad at me anyway :P (And anywhere else I decide to do it.)
well, if they let you boot from USB that's their fault not your's ;)
